tit.e: Manen Oban (Large-Sized Gold Coin of the Manen Era)
tit.cmt: 指示に従って補足説明を加えました。
tit.e: Manen Oban (Large-Sized Gold Coin of the Manen Era)

sen.j: 万延大判（まんえんおおばん）とは万延元年（1860年）閏3月に発行された大判であり、新大判（しんおおばん）とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: Manen Oban is a large-sized old Japanese gold coin issued in the intercalary March of Manen 1 (1860); it is also called Shin Oban.
Manen Oban is a large-sized old Japanese gold coin issued in intercalary April of 1860; it is also called Shin Oban.
sen.cmt: 年号の書き方が指示通りでなかったため修正しました。
sen.e: Manen Oban is a large-sized old Japanese gold coin issued in intercalary April of 1860; it is also called Shin Oban.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 万延大判はこれまでの大判と異なり通貨としての目的もあり、万延小判に対し二十五両金貨として発行された。
sen.e: Differing from the Oban (large-sized gold coin) issued up to that time, Manen Oban also had the purpose of to be used as a currency and it was issued as a 25-ryo gold coin against Manen Koban.

Differing from the Oban (large-sized gold coin) that had been issued up to that time, Manen Oban had the purpose of being used as a currency, and it was issued as a 25-ryo gold coin, 25 times of Manen Koban (small-sized gold coin of the Manen era).
sen.cmt: 原文に不足があり、万延小判は1両金貨であることが前提になっているため「万延小判に対し」としてあるようですので、「万延小判の25倍」と補足しました。合わせて、小判であることが分かるように補足説明も加えました。
sen.e: Differing from the Oban (large-sized gold coin) that had been issued up to that time, Manen Oban had the purpose of being used as a currency, and it was issued as a 25-ryo gold coin, 25 times of Manen Koban (small-sized gold coin of the Manen era).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 表面は「拾両後藤（花押）」と墨書され、後藤十七代典乗の書である。
sen.e: On the surface, a seal mark 'Ju-ryo Goto' is written in Indian ink by the 17th mint master Tenjo, the descendant of the mint master Shirobee GOTO; the total of four hallmarks of paulownia patterns in a circle are carved on the left, right, top and bottom of Manen Oban respectively; the shape is angular ellipse; this point is the same as the ones minted up to that time; however, the weight value is based on the one gold coin with 30 monme which was substantially lower in value compared with the weight value of gold coin up to that time in which the weight value was based on one gold coin with the weight value of 44 monme.
On the surface, a seal mark 'Ju-ryo Goto' was written in Indian ink by the 17th mint master Tenjo, the descendant of the mint master Shirobe GOTO.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処［現状ではセミコロンでいくつもの文がつながっていて不適切なため、分割しました。・表記の指示に従ってShirobee→Shirobeとしました。・不自然な表現を修正しました。
sen.e: On the surface, a seal mark 'Ju-ryo Goto' was written in Indian ink by the 17th mint master Tenjo, the descendant of the mint master Shirobe GOTO.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 上下左右に丸枠桐極印がそれぞれ一箇所、計四箇所打たれている。
sen.e: A total of four hallmarks of circular paulownia patterns are carved on the left, right, top and bottom of Manen Oban.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・不自然な表現を修正しました。
sen.e: A total of four hallmarks of circular paulownia patterns are carved on the left, right, top and bottom of Manen Oban.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 形状は角ばった楕円形であ点はこれまでの大判と同様である。
sen.e: It has a shape of angular ellipse, which is the same as the ones minted up to that time.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・不自然な表現を修正しました。
sen.e: It has a shape of angular ellipse, which is the same as the ones minted up to that time.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これまで原則として金一枚すなわち四十四匁を基準としてきた量目が大幅に引き下げられ、三十匁となった。
sen.e: However, the weight value was based on one gold coin of 30 monme, which was substantially lower in value than the weight value of a gold coin up to that time, 44 monme.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・不自然な表現を修正しました。
sen.e: However, the weight value was based on one gold coin of 30 monme, which was substantially lower in value than the weight value of a gold coin up to that time, 44 monme.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 表面は鏨目（たがねめ）のものと熨斗目（のしめ）のものが存在する。
sen.e: Manen Oban has two kinds of surface pattern. One is taganeme in which tiny dots were chiseled all over the surface without space; another one is noshime pattern which is pattern of binding knots; the ones with noshime pattern exceed in number in comparison with the ones with taganeme pattern.
Manen Oban has two kinds of surface patterns: taganeme, in which tiny dots were chiseled all over the surface without space, and noshime, which is a pattern of binding knots.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処(原文は2文以上がピリオドやセミコロンでつながっているため、分割しました。）

sen.j: 熨斗目の方が現存数が多い。
sen.e: There are more Manen Oban with the noshime pattern remaining than the ones with the taganeme pattern.

sen.j: 裏面の極印による鋳造高は以下のとおりである。
sen.e: The number of minted Manen Oban known based on the hallmark on the back side with taganeme pattern is 854 with '恒・宇・吉' (tsune, u, yoshi) and also with '伊・宇・き' (i, u, ki) in the period from the intercalary March 23 to April 25 of Manen 1 (1860); the number of minted Manen Oban with the hallmark of '吉・宇・き' (yoshi, u, ki) and 'yoshi, yasu, dai) in noshime pattern in the period from the April 29 of the same year to July 10 of Bunkyu 1 (1861) is 9,491; the number of minted Manen Oban in taganeme patter increases again in the period from July 11 of Bunkyu 1 (1861) to December 24 of Bunkyu 2 (1862); thus, the number of Manen Oban with the hallmark of '吉・宇・き' (yoshi, u, ki) was 4,565; the one with '吉・安・大' (yoshi, yasu, dai) was 2,187.
The numbers of minted Manen Oban that are known based on the hallmarks on the back side are as follows.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・不自然な表現を修正しました。
sen.e: The numbers of minted Manen Oban that are known based on the hallmarks on the back side are as follows.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 万延元年（1860年）閏3月23日より4月25日までは鏨目で「恒・宇・吉」および「伊・宇・き」が854枚である。
sen.e: From April 13, 1860, until June 14, 1860, a total of 854 Manen Oban with the hallmarks of '恒, 宇, 吉' (tsune, u, yoshi) and '伊, 宇, き' (i, u, ki) in the taganeme pattern were minted.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・不自然な表現を修正しました。・旧暦を修正しました。・「恒・宇・吉」および「伊・宇」の読みは検証できているか不明です。
sen.e: From April 13, 1860, until June 14, 1860, a total of 854 Manen Oban with the hallmarks of '恒, 宇, 吉' (tsune, u, yoshi) and '伊, 宇, き' (i, u, ki) in the taganeme pattern were minted.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同年4月29日から文久元年7月10日までは熨斗目で「吉・宇・き」および「吉・安・大」合計9,491枚である。
sen.e: From June 18, 1860, until August 15, 1861, a total of 9491 Manen Oban with the hallmarks of '吉, 宇, き' (yoshi, u, ki) and '吉, 安, 大' ('yoshi, yasu, dai) in the noshime pattern were minted.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・不自然な表現を修正しました。・旧暦を修正しました。・「吉・宇」および「吉・安・大」の読みは検証できているか不明です。
sen.e: From June 18, 1860, until August 15, 1861, a total of 9491 Manen Oban with the hallmarks of '吉, 宇, き' (yoshi, u, ki) and '吉, 安, 大' ('yoshi, yasu, dai) in the noshime pattern were minted.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 文久元年（1861年）7月11日から文久2年（1862年）12月24日は鏨目に戻り、「吉・宇・き」4,565枚、「吉・安・大」2,187枚であった。
sen.e: From August 16, 1861, until February 12, 1863, the pattern was changed back to taganeme; 4565 Manen Oban with the hallmarks of '吉, 宇, き' (yoshi, u, ki) in the taganeme pattern were minted, and 2187 Manen Oban with '吉, 安, 大' (yoshi, yasu, dai) in the taganeme pattern were minted.
sen.cmt: ・一原文一訳文例外対処・不自然な表現を修正しました。・旧暦を修正しました。・「吉・宇」および「吉・安・大」の読みは検証できているか不明です。
sen.e: From August 16, 1861, until February 12, 1863, the pattern was changed back to taganeme; 4565 Manen Oban with the hallmarks of '吉, 宇, き' (yoshi, u, ki) in the taganeme pattern were minted, and 2187 Manen Oban with '吉, 安, 大' (yoshi, yasu, dai) in the taganeme pattern were minted.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 通用期間は万延元年（1860年）4月10日より、古金銀通用停止の明治7年（1874年）9月末までであった。
sen.e: The period Manen Oban used was from April 10 of Manen 1 (1860) to the end of September of Meiji 7 (1874) in which the use of old gold coin and silver coin were stopped.
Manen Oban was used from May 30, 1860, until the end of September 1874, when the use of old gold and silver coins was stopped.
